Detailed Description

template<class T = double> template class MatrixBase

This is a pure virtual base class for Matrix.

Member Function Documentation

T * getElementsPointer ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the pointer to the first element in a matrix or vector.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, Matrix, and RowVector.

int getNumRows ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the number of rows in the Matrix. See the overloaded functions in the derived class Matrix.

Reimplemented in Matrix.

int getNumColumns ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the number of columns in the Matrix. See the overloaded functions in the derived class Matrix.

int column ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the element at the specified position.

Parameters:
row   Row number of the desired element.
column   Column number of the desired element.

Reimplemented in Matrix.

void setElement ( int row,
int column,
T elementValue ) [pure virtual]
 

Sets an element to a value at the specified position.

Parameters:
row   Row number of the desired element.
column   Column number of the desired element.
elementValue   The desired element is set to this value.

Reimplemented in Matrix.

Overloading the assignment operator to assign between two MatrixBase types of of same dimensions.

Reimplemented in Matrix.

MatrixInitializer< T > operator=<T> ( const T & elementValue ) [pure virtual]
 

This function provides an overloaded assignment operator for initializing a matrix.

Parameters:
elementValue   This is the value to which all elements in the matrix are initialized.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, Matrix, RowVector, and Vector.

void output ( ostream & outputStream = cout )
 

Returns:
The elements in the referenced matrix to the output stream (by default the output is to the console)
